newsitem.title: SPAIN: BASKETBALL-RUSSIA SCRAPE BY SPAIN INTO EUROPEAN SEMIS.
newsitem.headline: BASKETBALL-RUSSIA SCRAPE BY SPAIN INTO EUROPEAN SEMIS.

text.p: Russia scraped through the quarter-finals of the European championship on Friday after seeing Spain's Mike Smith miss a three-point shot that would have won the game with less than a second on the clock.

Russia's narrow victory over the hosts was in contrast to the other quarter-finals, in which Yugoslavia and Greece had lined up a semi-final clash with straightforward wins over Lithuania and Poland respectively.
Russia had to wait for the outcome of the game between Italy and Turkey to discover their semi-final opponents.
The Russians started nervously and failed to show the accuracy from the three-point line that had taken them through the opening phases.
Rafa Jofresa and Antonio Orenga had controlled the play for Spain in the first period, but the pair lost their way after the break.
Spain fell apart with five consecutive losses of possession, allowing Russia to force their way back from 43-36 down into a 45-43 lead.
The Russians kept their necks in front for the rest of the game, but were given a nervous final moment when Smith missed his three-pointer.
Evgeny Kissourin was fouled as he grabbed the rebound, and with time having run out was able to extend the margin of victory by one point to 70-67.
Earlier Yugoslavia had beaten Lithuania 75-60 and Greece came from behind to defeat Poland 72-62.
Yugoslavia, unexpectedly humbled by Italy on the second day, have won all their subsequent games and are again clear favourites for the title.
Predrag Danilovic hit 21 points and the Yugoslav dominance in the second half allowed coach Zeljko Obradovic to rest top guard Aleksander Djordjevic.
After winning both their groups in the opening phases, Greece looked in danger of losing their unbeaten record for a time.
But after trailing 45-55 early in the second period, the Greeks outscored the Poles 15-1, and cruised home untroubled.
